results.title: Wild bush budgie; a very particular parrot.
results.creator_credit: Gary Steer, Richard Campbell, ABC-TV (Australia), National Geographic Society and Sky Visuals
results.brief_description: Wild Bush Budgie: The Budgerigar is one of the most popular caged birds. In its native Outback environment, the humble “Budgie” is a master of survival. Introduces this common but very appealing bird. “A very particular parrot” profiles the rare Golden Shouldered Parrot. Only 150 pairs survive in the wild and private collectors are attempting to breed the species in order to safegaurd their survival.
results.title_for_label: Wild bush budgie; a very particular parrot.

results.title: Wild Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Many of the most interesting Australian animals are never seen in their natural habitat even by Australians. Perhaps its because many of them are nocturnal or, even more likely, because the animals are shy or live in such remote places that seeing them is usually by accident. “Wild Australia” reveals many little-known facts about ‘well-known` Australian animals, like the koala, platypus, echidna, Tasmania tiger, numbat, kangaroo and crocodile, filmed in their natural habitat.

results.title: Wild Africa: the energy cycle
results.creator_credit: James Murray, William Banting and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This film discusses the flow of energy from green plants through the herbivores and carnivores of the African plains. Various herbivores are shown eating and these in turn are food for carnivores. Concentrates on the flow of food energy. Taken from the orginal production entitled ‘Wild Africa: as it was’.

results.title: Wilbur wants to kill himself [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lone Scherfig, Sisse Olsen and Zentropa Entertainment6
results.brief_description: Set in Glasgow with Danish production “Wilbur wants to kill himself” is a bittersweet tale. Wilbur (Jamie Sives) has failed many attempts at suicide and having inherited a second hand book store is distracted from his morbid thoughts by an interesting customer. Supplementing her income by selling old books found in doctors waiting rooms Alice (Shirley Henderson) becomes part of Wilbur’s life. A charming comedy drama. Cast also includes Adrian Rawlings, Lisa McKinlay, Mads Mikkelson, Julia Davis and Susan Vidler.

results.title: Wigglemen tales: good goodies
results.creator_credit: Charlie O. Hayward and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: An animated film which demonstrates the effect of advertising and the power of words on the businessman and the consumer. Tells the story of two trucks selling “goodies” as they compete with each other for customers by erecting more and more advertising atop their trucks.

results.title: Whyspers
results.brief_description: Massive bronze heads atop towers of crumbling stone communicate via small grey servants. One day a thousand years later a visitor interrupts a conversation. A chinese whispers style mutation occurs as a result.

results.title: Why works information
results.creator_credit: Anglo-Scottish Pictures and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: The story, in humorously dramatised form, of how morale and production suffered in a factory which brought in new machines without informing its workers of the reason, and how the situation was relieved by the full use of bulletin-boards and the setting up of a Works Council.

results.title: Why won't Tommy eat?
results.creator_credit: Judith Crawley, Crawley Films and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The problem of children who won’t eat and what can be done about it. Uses example of the story of a small boy, Tommy, who wont eat. the need to understand the child is ilustrated, including consideration of habits that were begun in infancy. The necessity for a mother to be relaxed when feeding her baby, the importance of feeding the infant when he is hungry, the significance of pleasant surroundings, are emphasised. When Tommy’s mother assumes a new attitude toward Tommy, he begins to develop proper eating habits.
